content.description:
Nihil enim legit1 quod non excerperetexcerpo, -ere: to take notes on. Dicere etiam 
solebat nullum esse librum tam malum ut non aliqua 
parte prodesset.
 1:The subject of legit is Pliny the Elder.↩
content.question: In the passage, Pliny the Elder shows his ability to

choices.label: select only good books to read
find something good in any book
suggest ways to make bad books better
distinguish between good and bad books

content.answer: find something good in any book
